content:
HttpApplicationStateWrapper Class

In this Article

Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that enables information to be shared across multiple requests and sessions within an ASP.NET application.

Syntax

Declaration

public class HttpApplicationStateWrapper : System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • NameObjectCollectionBase
  • System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase
  • HttpApplicationStateWrapper

Remarks

The HttpApplicationStateWrapper class derives from the HttpApplicationStateBase class and serves as a wrapper for the HttpApplicationState class. This class exposes the functionality of the HttpApplicationState class while also exposing the HttpApplicationStateBase type. The HttpApplicationStateBase class enables you to replace the original implementation of the HttpApplicationState class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

Properties

    • NameObjectCollectionBase+KeysCollection

  • StaticObjects

    Gets all objects that are declared by an object element where the scope is set to "Application" in the ASP.NET application.

    public override System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase StaticObjects { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase

      A collection of objects in the application.

    Remarks

    Application objects are defined in the Global.asax file inside an element that has syntax like the following:

  • CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at the specified index in the array.

    public override void CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination for the elements that are copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in array at which to begin copying.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional.

      -or-

      The number of elements in the source HttpApplicationStateWrapper object is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.

    • InvalidCastException

      The type of the source HttpApplicationStateWrapper object cannot be cast to the type of the destination array.
